reviews.review_msg: Nice guy
hes good prof
He is super nice! Caring about students, get ready for exams with us together, tell us how to do well in exams follow his instruction you well at least get B+!

Dr. Mellow is such sweet man and prof. Despite his name, he is not mellow. He is particular and buzzes around class giving you millions of handouts to keep. Often his class consists of looking at the handouts, reading through them and highlighting, underlining and circling instructions. This was fine for in-person, online however, it was very dull.

Dr. Mellow is the most patient professor I have had at SFU. He answers every question we have. Even something he had said in class a lot of times. When you are not able to come to class, he will give you the handout and notes next class. He is the person who is really sweet, please choose the course if he teaches. It is worth.

-Extremely easy course if you have an aptitude for linguistics. I wish we had learned more content rather than just solve the same problems over and over again. He pretty much teaches whatever he wants which is not great for an intro course because it will make the next courses much harder. But it was an easy credit so oh well.

Extremely easy course if you have an aptitude for linguistics. I wish we had learned more content rather than just solve the same problems over and over again. He pretty much teaches whatever he wants which is not great for an intro course because it will make the next courses much harder. But it was an easy credit so oh well.

Very clear explanations, but you don't really learn much. He basically gives you all the answers you need for his midterm and final exam. Very strict on writing, which is odd because linguists are supposed to be descriptivists. Regardless, I am glad that I got to encounter Dean during my undergrad and wish he spoke more about his own work.

I have no idea why such morphologist are so willing to make every of his student a newspaper writer. Course itself is easy, and this professor who is the only authority of morphology at SFU claims that he likes every of his course is a writing course. If you like to teach a W course go teach it, not torturing students by bunch of papers.

Dr. Mellow is hands down one of my favourite professors. He is so clear on his expectations and really offers a lot of help outside the classroom for those who need help with their writing or understanding. He is kind, has great wit and is really passionate about what he teaches. I would highly recommend taking his class.

Everyone complains that this course is difficult, but he is very reasonable. This is a writing course so he is picky on grammar. All upper division courses are difficult, and this one is as well as it is a W course. Dr. Mellow is always available for help when you need it.

Dr. Mellow is one of my favorite professors in the Linguistics department. His lectures are very interesting, and timed extremely well. He is polite and respectful towards students, and available for help. He is a fair marker and very clear in his expectations. You always learn something new in his lectures and he is quite humorous as well.
A very clear lecturer.

A very concrete and lucid lecturer.  I also had him as a TA and he did a good job of engaging the entire class in guided problem solving-- not an easy task in an intro course!  He ran an extra seminar before the final and posted extra practice materials online.  Clearly knows his stuff, very organized, and interested in student input.

Dr. Mellow is a great prof. His lectures are clear, and he is always available for help. As long as you attend class and tutorials, the exams and assignments should be doable. But the grading scale for this class is crazy high. 91 is an A-
Dean's got a very nice personality, very caring, helpful, and orgainized. Make good use of the assignments, listen in lectures and u'll do fine in his class. =)

He is very organized, and an interesting professor. His grading system is extremely high. Like 97 and up is an A+. But if you pay close attention to his examples and assignments, you will find that the exam formats are quite similar. Overall, great prof.

Two years later this prof gets a sad face. How odd. Agree to prior rating. He just likes to teach what he wants, I didn't learn a single thing in how first language is acquired waste of my $600 tuition and initial interest. All 1 in class essay, midterm, final, and paper are difficult, for he ONLY cares on HOW you right not WHAT you write. AVOID!!!

Nice person but not a good teacher. He only marks you on how you write and not what you write, so if your not a good writer with an LPI of 6 then don't even think about getting an A or anything close to it. His 72% is a C-. It is not even a Writing intensive class. Did not learn anything in the class. if you take his class make sure u have LPI 6.
Pretty clear and organized prof. His lectures are very helpful, as he pretty much gives hints on how to do assignments and exams and what concepts can be ignored. Overall, pretty good class =)

Although he's known to be a tough marker, I think he's probably one of the professors that actually make sense during the lectures. His classes are very informative, but dry. He is very helpful indeed. To do well in his class, never get help last minute.

According to his course syllabus, you need at least 80% to get a B. That is absolutely ridiculous. Anything below 60% is a Fail. No part marks are given so if you make a minor mistake on anything (exam or assignment), you get a zero. Yes, the content is easy, but the class is not.

So I took this course thinking it was going to be easy. It is easy. VERY easy. However - the grade inflation in this class is nuts!! I got 87% on the midterm and it only scored me a B!! He is a tough marker as well. Tutorials are great since they supply you with all the info you need to write the exams, but otherwise, the text is near-useless.
He is a very tough marker.

Very well spoken and organized. He lays just about everything right one front of you. This class has a lot of material so be careful, but mellow will guide you through it really well. you can tell he really wants you to understand the material!
very strict on marking.
A very nice guy, which excellent teaching abilities and a high level of concern for providing fair tests and useful classes.
very easy. exams are exactly like assignments&practices
I don't like his attitude.... Very condescending toward non-native born speakers.
organized, well-prepared, hard working, fair, knowledgable, enthusiastic, nice, helpful, respectful, and student-centered. want to give him a hairstyle makeover though..

Dean should not all the time read the notes he prepared at home.  He should DELIVER lectures, not read them.    
 Also, he should make sure that his students are alert in class and not fall asleep.
he's ok, really boring and way too many examples and not enough explaning...but if you can't do sematics or write essays, you can drop from and A to a C in no time
don't buy the textbook!!
easy course!
Good course for easy credit.  May struggle a bit if English isn't your first language, otherwise it's a breeze.  He tries to give fair, objective exams, which makes them easier to do.

Dean is one of my favourite profs! He is quite clear, very concerned about giving fair tests, super helpful in office hours, very smart, really nice, and he won't make you memorize a ton of stuff you'll just forget. An all round great guy!
Nice prof, and he really wanna helps students learn. Exams are easy.
What a kind & smart prof. He is not patronizing at all like so many profs are. Clear expectations and consistent marker. Very excited about ling. If anything, could get more specific at times.
easy class if you read the assignments and midterms extremely carefully.

Dean's a total sweetheart who really tries to help students. He's really clear on his expectations. You always know what he wants of you. His lectures can be a wee bit boring at times, but he tries so hard you can't really fault him.
really smart guy.
Really nice guy, very easy course. I slept through half the classes and ended up with 96%. His exams are very slack, hopefully he toughens them up in the future.
No Comments
Rather tedious, but a fairly easy class.
easy course, nice teacher
Bright, well-spoken prof, but could go into more interesting details.
No Comments
No Comments
